agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Public Health TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Wednesday, April 24, 2019 PLACE: E2.026 CHAIR: Rep. Senfronia Thompson The chair may limit testimony time and the number of testifying witnesses to ensure consideration of posted and pending business, especially if testimony would cause the public hearing to extend into the next calendar day. HB 146 Minjarez | et al. Relating to the adoption of cats and dogs previously used for research. HB 562 Thierry | et al. Relating to warning labels for opioid prescription drugs. HB 2059 Blanco Relating to required human trafficking prevention training for health care practitioners and certain employees of health care facilities. HB 2133 Klick Relating to public access to certain hospital inspection and investigation information and materials. HB 2250 Lucio III Relating to the prescribing and ordering of Schedule II controlled substances by certain advanced practice registered nurses and physician assistants. HB 2410 Klick Relating to a request for a nursing peer review determination. HB 2785 Burrows Relating to notice of discount of certain charges by certain hospitals. HB 3304 Raymond | et al. Relating to the repeal of certain provisions affecting the electronic exchange of health information. HB 3862 Bohac Relating to notice of the cash price of certain health care services by certain hospitals. HB 3685 Oliverson Relating to pharmacy benefits provided through the Medicaid managed care program. HB 3874 Sheffield Relating to the publication of information regarding the national organ transplant waiting list on the Department of State Health Services' Internet website and certain registrations for the anatomical gift registry. HB 3970 Sheffield Relating to the definition of "non-physician mental health professional" for purposes of the Texas Mental Health Code. HB 4036 Dominguez Relating to billing requirements for certain health care facilities. HB 4137 Israel Relating to the required notice of a patient's right to receive an estimate of certain health care services provided by a physician. HB 4455 Miller Relating to the provision of mental health services through a telemedicine medical service or telehealth service. HCR 76 Price Recognizing the first week of May 2019 as TD Awareness Week. HCR 117 Johnson, Jarvis Designating September as Sickle Cell Disease Awareness Month for a 10-year period beginning in 2019. HCR 126 Swanson Recognizing pornography as a public health hazard. Bills deleted after last posting: HB 4014 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
